title: Honours for Antia Cleopatra, sacerdos
support: A large statue base in a coarse soft yellow limestome, with a very porous surface. Intact on the left, damaged and missing the lower front right corner, and to a lesser exten the upper rear right corner. Most of the frontal epigraphic field is preserved (H 73.3 cm, W 57 cm max), but the ends of all lines after line 2 are lost. Moulding top and bottom, which extend around the sides, but not to the rear, which is straight and roughly finished. The top of the basis projects in square section above the moulding, by some 17.5cm. There are two small indentations on the top, but the middle and rear right side of the top are missing. No traces of footholes. The gap at the end of the lines increases steadily from c.8cm in line 4, to 10-12 cm by line 11.

layout.p: 11 lines of regular neat wide letters of faily consistent size and spacing, with a regular left margin, almost entirely filling the available field.

handNote.lettering: regular letters iwth a faily wide square module, lacking visible interpuncts or serifs (but note the material); use of ligature at the end of line 2.

date._: Bivona dates to 2nd century CE by lettering

provenanceFound._: Found 1768 in vicinity of the Castle

provenanceObserved._: Prag 2022-07-08, in the courtyard of the museum.

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

museum.name: Museo Civico Baldassare Romano
museum.description: A large and well-displayed collection. It begins with three ante-rooms, in the first of which is a rich display of lithics (mainly Neolithic) from the surrounding area. A display of material from Himera (lion-head spouts from the Temple of Victory and red-figure craters being the principle pieces) and a numismatic gallery then follow before the main room which contains Hellenistic and Roman material from Termini Imerese itself. Small finds, sculpture and inscriptions predominate. The museum collection continues upstairs with non-archaeological material (and a single inscription). The courtyard of the building holds a large collection of architectural pieces and inscriptions

location.address: Via Marco Tullio Cicerone, 90018 - Termini Imerese (PA)
